alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Chariton; Linn; Livingston (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 2:40PM CDT until May 03 at 4:31PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Missouri... Grand River near Sumner affecting Linn MO, Chariton, Livingston and Carroll Counties. For the Grand River...including Sumner...Moderate flooding is forecast. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River near Sumner. * WHEN...From this evening to Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Bottomland 1 to 2 miles south of the gage begins to flood. At 26.0 feet, Rural land adjacent to the river is flooded. At 28.0 feet, Rural roads are under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 23.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 30.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
